author: kfogel
msg: * subversion/libsvn_client/update.c
(svn_client_update): Reactivate externals handling.
* subversion/libsvn_client/switch.c
(svn_client_switch): Gather traversal info, then handle any
externals changes.

author: rooneg
msg: let's try this one more time...
* subversion/libsvn_client/export.c
(remove_admin_dirs, copy_versioned_files): make val non-const to avoid a
compiler warning.

author: sussman
msg: Fix bug #712, a big fat P1 issue.
("svn_wc_merge fails on files with eol/keyword translation").
This bug was discovered & diagnosed by Josef Wolf <jw@raven.inka.de>.
* merge.c (svn_wc_merge): the tmp_left & tmp_right copies of left &
right must be created as unique-files that are clones of
*tmp_target*, not merge_target.  Normally merge_target ==
tmp_target, so we'd never seen this bug till attempting to merge a
translated file.  When merge_target is de-translated into some
tmp_target in.svn/tmp/, the other inputs are now created in the same
administrative area.  At that point, there's no need to pass
basenames of these 3 files to svn_io_run_diff3 anymore; they're all
relative paths below merge_target's parent, which is all that
svn_io_run_diff3 requires in the first place.  We can run
svn_io_run_diff3 in "." from now on, since all input paths should
now be relative to "." as well.
Everyone follow that?  :-)

author: rooneg
msg: * subversion/libsvn_client/export.c
(remove_admin_dirs, copy_versioned_files): declare key and val as const
void *'s rather than just void *'s.  key has to be const for apr_hash_this,
and there's no reason for val not to be const, since we never need to
modify it anyway, so why bother putting it on it's own line ;-)
Should Silence Warnings Reported By:  Philip Martin <philip@codematters.co.uk>

author: gstein
msg: Define the RA_*_DEPS variables before they get used (indirectly) in
dependency lines. 'make' evaluates dep lines when it finds them, so
the values must be defined by then.
Problem identified by Philip Martin <philip@codematters.co.uk>
* build/gen_base.py:
(MakefileGenerator.write): no longer collect the RA modules into the
ra_modules list, nor write out the DEPS and LINK variables.
Instead, call self.write_ra_modules() to do the work, and to do it
"early" in the file.
(MakefileGenerator.write_ra_modules): new method to write out the RA
modules.
